meanings.definition: A post at the head or foot of a bed, often used to support a canopy or curtains.
meanings.sent1: The bedpost at the head of the bed was beautifully carved.
meanings.sent2: She tied the curtains to the bedpost to keep the sunlight out.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the bedpost was a great scratching post.
meanings.sent4: His dreams clung to the bedpost like tendrils of mist.
meanings.sent5: The bedpost stood tall and sturdy, a sentinel at the head of the bed.

meanings.definition: To secure or fasten to a bedpost.
meanings.sent1: He would always bedpost his favorite teddy bear before going to sleep.
meanings.sent2: She carefully bedposts the picture frame to the bed to prevent it from falling.
meanings.sent3: The magician bedposted the scarf to the bedpost, making it disappear in a flash.
meanings.sent4: His memories were bedposted to the bedpost, anchoring them in place.
meanings.sent5: She bedposts her worries to the bedpost, letting them stay there overnight.
